title: Barratt chief's pay jumps as Help to Buy boosts property market
text:
Barratt's chief executive received an £893,000 pay bump this year, taking his total annual remuneration at Britain's biggest housebuilder to £3.6m.

David Thomas’s salary and benefits edged up £27,000 to £949,000, while his bonus and incentives jumped £866,000 to £2.66m, Barratt’s annual report revealed.

The increases came despite FTSE 100-listed Barratt’s annual revenues dipping 2.3pc to £4.8bn.

However, the revenue decline was offset by higher profit margins, with pre-tax profits rising 8.9pc to £910m.

Executive pay at UK housebuilders has come under fire recently, with accusations that profits are being driven by the taxpayer-funded Help to Buy scheme rather than chief executives’ leadership...
